sentences.en: A short walk will limber up the legs.
sentences.cn: 散一小会儿步能放松腿部。

sentences.en: Before running, he liked limber up.
sentences.cn: 在跑步前, 他喜欢热身使身体柔软灵活.

sentences.en: By now he was perspiring and felt warmer and more limber.
sentences.cn: 他身上见了点汗,暖和,也轻松了一些.

sentences.en: Cats stretch every day to keep themselves limber and flexible.
sentences.cn: 猫每天都做伸展动作,让自己灵活且充满弹性.

sentences.en: Do will definitely help you to become or to stay limber.
sentences.cn: 我一定会帮你成为或留可塑的.

sentences.en: He ordered the troops to limber up and move out.
sentences.cn: 他命令部队把炮装上前车开出去.

sentences.en: He was as strong as an oak, and roughly as limber.
sentences.cn: 他如同橡树一样结实, 懒懒散散.

sentences.en: He was told to extend and limber up before doing any exercises.
sentences.cn: 他被告知在做任何工作之前应伸展四肢.

sentences.en: I saw her go to the corner and select a long, green, limber switch.
sentences.cn: 我看到她走到墙角,挑了一根绿色的, 有弹性的长树条.

sentences.en: I'd relax. I would limber up.
sentences.cn: 我会更放松, 我会更随性.

sentences.en: The colonel ordered the soldiers to limber up.
sentences.cn: 上校命令士兵们把火炮系在前车上.

sentences.en: The commander ordered the troops to limber up and move out.
sentences.cn: 指挥官下令把炮装上牵引车开出去.

sentences.en: You should limber up your muscles and joints.
You should limber up your wits before the test.
sentences.cn: 在测验之前你该动动脑筋.

phrases.tran_cn: （使）变柔软；在剧烈运动前作准备活动

trans.tran_cn: （赛前）做准备活动，把（火炮）系在前车上，（体育运动、比赛等前）做准备活动，做热身运动
